A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: All these people giving the movie 1 star or a 1/2 star\, really? Anyone that rates this movie so poorly is either just exaggerating because the movie didn’t meet their expectations or just isn’t a true Star Wars fan. It wasn’t the best of the series\, but it did take it in a new direction which opens up a lot of new possibilities. The new characters are all still extremely likable and are primed to carry on the saga without the heroes from episode 4-6. The Last Jedi has lots of action and a good plot. I doesn’t really answer well some questions that I think everyone was hoping for. I still have no real idea who Snoke is and despite how powerful he is made to initially seem\, he ends up being a fairly weak character. His origin is still a complete mystery\, and he ends up being more of a subplot than a super villain. You do find out who Rey’s parents are\, sort of. It is very anticlimactic and does not give any explanation as to how she is so strong in the Force. There are so many plot twists in the movie that it at times seems disjointed. Definitely worth watching though if you’re a Star Wars fan. They can’t all be the best movie ever\, and it does do a great job of opening up possibilities for episode 9 and beyond.
